alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Coast including Downtown Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 12 at 10:17AM PST until January 12 at 9:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 5 to 8 feet with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Los Angeles County Coast and Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands. * WHEN...Until 9 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of drowning due to the dangerous conditions. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Surf will be highest on exposed west facing beaches.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, so stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Coast including Downtown Los Angeles
